00022 void initQuESTEnv(QuESTEnv *env){
00023         // init MPI environment
00024         env->rank=0;
00025         env->numRanks=1;
00026 
00027     // init MT random number generator with two keys -- time and pid
00028     unsigned long int secs = time(NULL);
00029     unsigned long int pid = getpid();
00030     unsigned long int key[2];
00031     key[0] = secs; key[1] = pid;
00032     init_by_array(key, 2);
00033 }

00047 void reportQuESTEnv(QuESTEnv env){
00048         printf("EXECUTION ENVIRONMENT:\n");
00049         printf("Running locally on one node\n");
00050         printf("Number of ranks is %d\n", env.numRanks);
00051 # ifdef _OPENMP
00052         printf("OpenMP enabled\n");
00053         printf("Number of threads available is %d\n", omp_get_max_threads());
00054 # else
00055         printf("OpenMP disabled\n");
00056 # endif
00057         printf("Precision: size of REAL is %ld bytes\n", sizeof(REAL));
00058 }

00064 REAL calcTotalProbability(MultiQubit multiQubit){
00065   /* IJB - implemented using Kahan summation for greater accuracy at a slight floating
00066      point operation overhead. For more details see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kahan_summation_algorithm */
00067   /* Don't change the bracketing in this routine! */
00068   REAL pTotal=0; 
00069   REAL y, t, c;
00070   long long int index;
00071   long long int numAmpsPerRank = multiQubit.numAmps;
00072   c = 0.0;
00073   for (index=0; index<numAmpsPerRank; index++){ 
00074     /* Perform pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]; by Kahan */
00075    // pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.real[index];
00076     
00077     y = multiQubit.stateVec.real[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.real[index] - c;
00078     t = pTotal + y;
00079     c = ( t - pTotal ) - y;
00080     pTotal = t;
00081     
00082     /* Perform pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]; by Kahan */
00083     //pTotal+=multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index];
00084     
00085     
00086     y = multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index]*multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index] - c;
00087     t = pTotal + y;
00088     c = ( t - pTotal ) - y;
00089     pTotal = t;
00090     
00091     
00092   } 
00093   return pTotal;
00094 }

00101         return multiQubit.stateVec.imag[index];

00104 void compactUnitary(MultiQubit multiQubit, const int targetQubit, Complex alpha, Complex beta) 
00105 {
00106     QuESTAssert(targetQubit >= 0 && targetQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 1, __func__);
00107     QuESTAssert(validateAlphaBeta(alpha, beta), 6, __func__);
00108 
00109         // all values required to update state vector lie in this rank
00110         compactUnitaryLocal(multiQubit, targetQubit, alpha, beta);
00111 }

00113 void unitary(MultiQubit multiQubit, const int targetQubit, ComplexMatrix2 u) 
00114 {
00115     QuESTAssert(targetQubit >= 0 && targetQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 1, __func__);
00116     QuESTAssert(validateMatrixIsUnitary(u), 5, __func__);
00117 
00118         // all values required to update state vector lie in this rank
00119         unitaryLocal(multiQubit, targetQubit, u);
00120 }

00122 void controlledCompactUnitary(MultiQubit multiQubit, const int controlQubit, const int targetQubit, Complex alpha, Complex beta) 
00123 {

00126     QuESTAssert(controlQubit != targetQubit, 3, __func__);
00127     QuESTAssert(validateAlphaBeta(alpha, beta), 6, __func__);
00128     
00129 
00130         controlledCompactUnitaryLocal(multiQubit, controlQubit, targetQubit, alpha, beta);
00131 }

00133 void controlledUnitary(MultiQubit multiQubit, const int controlQubit, const int targetQubit, ComplexMatrix2 u) 
00134 {
00135     QuESTAssert(targetQubit >= 0 && targetQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 1, __func__);
00136     QuESTAssert(controlQubit >= 0 && controlQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00137     QuESTAssert(controlQubit != targetQubit, 3, __func__);
00138     QuESTAssert(validateMatrixIsUnitary(u), 5, __func__);
00139    
00140         controlledUnitaryLocal(multiQubit, controlQubit, targetQubit, u);
00141 }
00142 
00143 void multiControlledUnitary(MultiQubit multiQubit, int* controlQubits, const int numControlQubits, const int targetQubit, ComplexMatrix2 u) 
00144 {
00145     QuESTAssert(targetQubit >= 0 && targetQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 1, __func__);
00146     QuESTAssert(numControlQubits > 0 && numControlQubits <= multiQubit.numQubits, 4, __func__);
00147     QuESTAssert(validateMatrixIsUnitary(u), 5, __func__);
00148 
00149     long long int mask=0; 
00150     for (int i=0; i<numControlQubits; i++) mask = mask | (1LL<<controlQubits[i]);
00151     QuESTAssert(mask >=0 && mask <= (1LL<<multiQubit.numQubits)-1, 2, __func__);
00152     QuESTAssert((mask & (1LL<<targetQubit)) != (1LL<<targetQubit), 3, __func__);
00153         
00154     multiControlledUnitaryLocal(multiQubit, targetQubit, mask, u);
00155 }

00189 REAL findProbabilityOfOutcome(MultiQubit multiQubit, const int measureQubit, int outcome)
00190 {
00191     QuESTAssert(measureQubit >= 0 && measureQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00192         REAL stateProb=0;
00193         stateProb = findProbabilityOfZeroLocal(multiQubit, measureQubit);
00194         if (outcome==1) stateProb = 1.0 - stateProb;
00195         return stateProb;
00196 }
00197 
00198 REAL collapseToOutcome(MultiQubit multiQubit, const int measureQubit, int outcome)
00199 {
00200     QuESTAssert(measureQubit >= 0 && measureQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00201     QuESTAssert((outcome==0 || outcome==1), 10, __func__);
00202     REAL stateProb;
00203         stateProb = findProbabilityOfOutcome(multiQubit, measureQubit, outcome);
00204     QuESTAssert(fabs(stateProb)>REAL_EPS, 8, __func__);
00205     collapseToOutcomeLocal(multiQubit, measureQubit, stateProb, outcome);
00206     return stateProb;
00207 }
00208 
00209 int measure(MultiQubit multiQubit, int measureQubit){
00210     QuESTAssert(measureQubit >= 0 && measureQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00211     REAL stateProb;
00212     return measureWithStats(multiQubit, measureQubit, &stateProb);
00213 }
00214 
00215 int measureWithStats(MultiQubit multiQubit, int measureQubit, REAL *stateProb){
00216     QuESTAssert(measureQubit >= 0 && measureQubit < multiQubit.numQubits, 2, __func__);
00217 
00218     int outcome;
00219     // find probability of qubit being in state 1
00220         REAL stateProbInternal = findProbabilityOfOutcome(multiQubit, measureQubit, 1);
00221 
00222     // we can't collapse to a state that has a probability too close to zero
00223     if (stateProbInternal<REAL_EPS) outcome=0;
00224     else if (1-stateProbInternal<REAL_EPS) outcome=1;
00225     else {
00226         // ok. both P(0) and P(1) are large enough to resolve
00227         // generate random float on [0,1]
00228         float randNum = genrand_real1();
00229         if (randNum<=stateProbInternal) outcome = 1;
00230         else outcome = 0;
00231     } 
00232     if (outcome==0) stateProbInternal = 1-stateProbInternal;
00233     collapseToOutcomeLocal(multiQubit, measureQubit, stateProbInternal, outcome);
00234     *stateProb = stateProbInternal;
00235     return outcome;
00236 }

00238 void exitWithError(int errorCode, const char* func){
00239     printf("!!!\n");
00240     printf("QuEST Error in function %s: %s\n", func, errorCodes[errorCode]);
00241     printf("!!!\n");
00242     printf("exiting..\n");
00243     exit(errorCode);
00244 }
00245 
00246 void QuESTAssert(int isValid, int errorCode, const char* func){
00247     if (!isValid) exitWithError(errorCode, func);
00248 }
